text: Golden Hours was an American juvenile magazine published by Norman Munro in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. ==History and profile== Golden Hours was first published in January 1888. H. Irving Hancock produced more than 50 serials for this magazine between 1889 and 1904. The magazine was based in Cincinnati, Ohio. ==References== ==External links== * – where it is a "non- genre" magazine Category:Children's magazines published in the United States Category:Defunct magazines published in the United States Category:Magazines established in 1888 Category:Magazines disestablished in 1904 Category:Magazines published in Cincinnati
title: Golden Hours (magazine)
